Posts.Content: Saw Dr. Chen, Dr. radiation Oncology, today and my weight and insurance restrict me from doing Cyberknife, however, IMRT looks like the best option. Based on the aggressive gleason 8 reading and to ensure cancer hasn't spread out of the prostate I'm having a bone scan and ct scan on Monday. I'm starting on hormone therapy as soon as I can get into the urologist. So no good news to report. Bill
Posts.Title: Tested positive on Biopsy. What next?

Posts.Content: I'm 63 year old male. I weigh 370 lbs and just found out I have Prostate cancer. My biopsy came back with 4+4=8 80% of tissue cancer in only 1 section. All other sections were cancer free. The cancer is still contained in the prostate. The Doctor is recommending cyberknife radiation for 5 days 30 minutes per day. How bad off am I really and thoughts on recommended treatment? Anyone in a similar situation sharing comments would be very helpful. Thank you
Posts.Title: Tested positive on Biopsy. What next?

Posts.Content: Thank you for the replies. Yes he mentioned because of my size surgery may be a challenge. I have an appointment at the cancer center on Wednesday.
